edu.ucsc.cross.hse.core.environment

Class EnvironmentSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsc.cross.hse.core.environment.EnvironmentSettings

  • public class EnvironmentSettings
extends java.lang.Object
    The settings that define how computations are handled and data is collected. Intended Operator: User

    • Field Detail

      • dataPointInterval

        public double dataPointInterval
        Time between data point storage.

      • domainPriority

        public DomainPriority domainPriority
        Specifies how domain will be determined when a system is in both flow and jump set.

      • eventHandlerConvergenceThreshold

        public java.lang.Double eventHandlerConvergenceThreshold
        The convergence threshold is the threshold in which a value is considered to be approximately the same as another value.

      • eventHandlerMaximumCheckInterval

        public java.lang.Double eventHandlerMaximumCheckInterval
        The maximum number of times the integrator will attempt to close in on a jump. Since events are only problem-dependent and are triggered by the independent time variable and the state vector, they can occur at virtually any time, unknown in advance. The integrators will take care to avoid sign changes inside the steps, they will reduce the step size when such an event is detected in order to put this event exactly at the end of the current step. This guarantees that step interpolation (which always has a one step scope) is relevant even in presence of discontinuities. This is independent from the stepsize control provided by integrators that monitor the local error (this event handling feature is available for all integrators, including fixed step ones).

      • integrator

        public FirstOrderIntegratorFactory integrator
        Integrator factory that will be the integrator to use.

      • maxEventHandlerIterations

        public int maxEventHandlerIterations
        Maximum number of iterations for the event handler.

      • maximumJumps

        public int maximumJumps
        Maximum time allowed before execution terminates.

      • maximumTime

        public double maximumTime
        Maximum number of jumps allowed before execution terminates.

      • storeNonPrimativeData

        public boolean storeNonPrimativeData
        Flag indicating if non primitive data is to be stored.
